title: Life Still Uncomfortable For Many Of France's Jews
teaser: NPR's Robert Siegel speaks with Roger Cukierman, president of the Council of French Jewish Institutions. They discuss the climate in France following last month's attack on a kosher supermarket in Paris, and an appeal by Israel's prime minister for French Jews to emigrate to Israel.
contentencoded: Copyright 2015 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
